data.text: @NjbBari3 @YouAreLobbyLud “Treated at home” we’re all home c+ and there is no “treatment” it’s more like “stay home and let us know if you can’t breath” …where is advice on vitamins/supplements, avoiding blood clots, faster recovery?! 🤷🏻‍♀️

@EndemicPrepared @NjbBari3 I meant this without COVID btw to anyone reading.

not nearly clear enough.

@EndemicPrepared @NjbBari3 Yeah, they supposedly help deny the virus cholesterol and it has trouble invading cells.

But reports are mixed though testing can be dubious.

@DonEford @NjbBari3 Well yeah the vascular system is being damaged. I also wonder if this is why some long haulers have improved on #Statins 

But it def needs watching on ground medically & studies!
@GHCuthbertson We have to wait… but I think it is unlikely to be back to baseline after multiple infections.

@EndemicPrepared @NjbBari3 We associate this with diet but it seems like diet will control what the cholesterol is made of but something still needs to trigger its release.

And some folks who have bad cholesterol could have better mtDNA that protects from this so the damage is less significant?

@NjbBari3 Any indication how much vaccination reduces these risks?

The study appears to be on pre-vaccination cases, so I'm hoping the vaccines greatly help.

@EndemicPrepared @NjbBari3 This got me thinking... what if... viral infection or some type of damage is causing cholesterol release and that is part of why some... healthy-ish people get damage from unexplained cholesterol build-up?

Like some Mito dysfunction was causing something not to parse correctly?
